chapter.pericope: The Doom of the Wicked City is Certain

ul.li1: 1Woe to the city that has shed much blood!Literally “bloods”
ul.li2: She is a deceiver,Literally “All of her is deception”
ul.li1: She is filled with plunder,
ul.li2: She has hoarded her spoils of war.Literally “Prey does not depart”
ul.li1: 2The crack of the whip!
ul.li2: The rumbling of the chariot wheel!
ul.li1: The galloping of the horse!
ul.li2: The racing of the chariot!
ul.li1: 3Chariots charge!
ul.li2: Swords flash!
ul.li1: Many corpses are piled high!Literally “Many dead, piles of corpses”
ul.li2: There is no end to the slain!

chapter.pericope: Harlot Nineveh Will Get What She Deserves

ul.li1: 4“Because of the many idolatries of the prostitute,
ul.li2: the beautiful charm of a mistress of witchcraft,
ul.li1: she who enslaves nations by her harlotries,
ul.li2: and peoples by her sorceries,
ul.li1: 5“Look! I am against you!” declaresLiterally “a declaration of”Yahweh.
ul.li2: “I will strip up your skirts over your face;
ul.li3: I will let nations look at your nakedness and your shame.
ul.li1: 6“I will throw filth upon you,
ul.li2: I will treat you with contempt,
ul.li3: I will make you a spectacle.
ul.li1: 7“And it will be that everyone who sees you will flee from you,
ul.li2: And theyHebrew “he” will say, ‘Nineveh is destroyed!’
ul.li1: Who will mourn for her?
ul.li2: From whence shall I seek comforters for you?”

chapter.pericope: Nineveh Will Suffer the Same Fate She Inflicted on Thebes

ul.li1: 8Are you better than Thebes?Hebrew “No-Amon”
ul.li2: She who sits at the Nile, surrounded by her waters,
ul.li1: her rampart was the sea and water was her wall.
9Cush was her strength, Egypt without end;
ul.li2: Put and Libya were among your allies.Literally “your helpers”
ul.li1: 10Yet she went into captivity as an exile;
ul.li2: her children were dashed to pieces at the head of the streets;
ul.li1: they cast lots for all of her nobles;
ul.li2: all of her dignitaries were bound with chains.
ul.li1: 11You also will behave like a drunkard;
ul.li2: You also will hide yourself;
ul.li3: You also will seek refuge from the enemy.

ul.li1: 12All of your fortifications are like fig trees with ripe firstfruits—
ul.li2: if they are shaken, they will fall into the mouth of the eater.
ul.li1: 13Look! Your troops are like women in your midst.
ul.li2: The gates of your land are wide open to your enemies;
ul.li3: fire will consume the bars of your gates.
ul.li1: 14Draw water for a siege!
ul.li2: Strengthen your fortifications!
ul.li1: Go to the mud pit!
ul.li2: Trample the clay!
ul.li1: 15There fire will consume you;
ul.li2: the sword will cut you off.
ul.li3: It will consume you like the locust.

ul.li1: Multiply yourself like the locust!
ul.li2: Multiply yourself like the grasshopper!
ul.li1: 16You have increased your merchants more than the stars of heaven;
ul.li2: like the locust they will shed their skin and fly away.
ul.li1: 17Your officials are like locusts;
ul.li2: your commanders are like a swarm of locusts.
ul.li1: They encamp on the walls on a cold day;
ul.li2: when the sun rises, they fly away—
ul.li3: no one knows where they have gone.

chapter.pericope: Nineveh Will Come to an End

ul.li1: 18Your shepherds are sleeping, O king of Assyria!
ul.li2: Your nobles slumber.
ul.li1: Your people are scattered on the mountains;
ul.li2: no one can gather them.
ul.li1: 19There is no healing for your wound;
ul.li2: your injury is fatal.
ul.li1: All who hear the report of you will clap their hands for joy concerning you,
ul.li2: For who has not suffered at the hands of your endless cruelty?Literally “For over whom has your endless cruelty not passed?”
